CatDescriptText: Mary Brown, secretary, Munhall and Christine Duncan, department store employe[e], 1820 Funston St. were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, January 23, 1960, pg. A1 with question "Do you believe the people who vote only for the President every four years make the best citizens?"  Ms. Brown's answer reads: "No.  You should vote in every election.  That's the only way you can get good government."  Mrs. Duncan's answer reads "My honest opinion is no.  That way, the person does not have knowledge of the candidate or the party."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Mary Brown wearing eyeglasses and plaid scarf, standing in front of flecked wall, Downtown; Portrait of Christine Duncan wearing dark coat with fur collar and light colored button earrings, standing in front of flecked wall, Downtown
